entry.title: [//gpu] Add ClientSharedImage::GetTextureTarget(BufferFormat)
entry.content:
This is a variant of GetTextureTarget() that will support conversion of

clients that use the following pattern:



texture_target =

NativeBufferNeedsPlatformSpecificTextureTarget(format) ?

GetPlatformSpecificTextureTarget() : GL_TEXTURE_2D;



In the fullness of time we will merge the different

CSI::GetTextureTarget(...) variants into a CSI::GetTextureTarget()

function that internalizes all the necessary logic.

entry.title: android: SurfaceControl same AHB with new fence
entry.content:
Allow calling SurfaceControl SetBuffer using the same buffer but new

fence.



Previously the assumption is there is a queue of buffers and a new fence

is fence is needed only when there is a new buffer. This no longer holds

with single buffered canvas in overlay which will keep using the same

buffer each frame, but potentially with a new fence. So allow this case.



DCHECK in SetReadFence for this single buffer case because each

SetReadFence call corresponds to a SetBuffer call, but there is no

guarantee on exact timing, and now there can be multiple SetBuffer call

using the same buffers. It's minimally useful so just remove it.



Bug: 40288143

entry.title: Optimize internal string container of WatermarkView
entry.content:
WatermarkView doesn't need the strings it holds to be `std::strings`,

so changing that type to `SkTextBlob` instead will optimize the

implementation of the watermark painting by not continuously

reallocating new memory for blocks of text.

entry.title: [mullhet] Add "Manage password" button.
entry.content:
This CL adds "Manage password" button the the manage password

details view. The button is added only if the feature flag is on.

Previously, parent view added a margin to the bottom of this view.

Now, the margin should be 0 so that this view looks the same as

the manage passwords view and its "Manage passwords" button.



The functionality of opening the password settings page will be

implemented in the subsequent CLs.



Please note that "Manage password" and "Manage passwords" are

different buttons: the newly added button should navigate to

the settings page where the user can edit a specific password.

The existing "Manage passwords" button navigates just to the

password manager page.



Please note that the icons are not aligned properly right now, because

RichHoverButton spacing parameters are not the same as those used to

create username and password rows. This alignment will be done in a

separate CL.



Mocks: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/7PFuGmewmVZ3QJP.png

Implementation: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/8D5TZggFyKFYv4B.png



Bug: b/326230114

entry.title: [UNOp2][Android] Add option to open the expanded sign-in bottom sheet
entry.content:
When the user selects "Choose Account" from sign-in promo (e.g. in the

bookmark manager"), the new sign-in flow should start and show the

expanded sign-in bottom sheet with an accounts list, instead of the

collapsed one.



As a first step, this CL updates the sign-in account picker bottom

sheet, by creating the AccountPickerLaunchMode enum, and use it in the

coordinator constructor, to allow the embedder to choose which view

should be shown when the bottom sheet appears.



It also adds a few tests for the newly introduced launch mode. The

AccountPickerBottomSheetTest test suite is updated with new tests

in a separated CL (https://crrev.com/c/5345254) since flakiness fix

for existing test was necessary.

entry.title: [UPMLocalPwd] Add metrics for local passwords migration
entry.content:
The CL introduces 3 count histograms:

- PasswordManager.UnifiedPasswordManager.MigrationForLocalUsers.

AddedToAndroidBackend - number of credentials added to GmsCore during

migration.

- PasswordManager.UnifiedPasswordManager.MigrationForLocalUsers.

UpdatedInAndroidBackend - number of credentials, which already existed

in GmsCore but were updated during migration.

- PasswordManager.UnifiedPasswordManager.MigrationForLocalUsers.

MidratedToAndroidBackendTotal - number of credentials added or updated

in GmsCore during migraion.



The metric is written after the migration is done for all credentials

that were successfully migrated.

entry.title: Fix bad variant access in CookieSettings
entry.content:
Before the CL: On construction, CookiesSettings checks the flag

kHostIndexedMetadataGrants to decide whether content_settings_ will be

of type EntryIndex or EntryMap. On every access of content_settings_,

the flag is checked again to decide the type to pass to absl::get<>.



Problem: In some tests, it seems the class is constructed with the flag

enabled but destroyed with the flag disabled, causing content_settings_

to be accessed with the wrong type. Given the presence of

CreateDeleteCookieOnExitPredicate() in the stack trace, I speculate

the flag overrides of fieldtrial_testing_config.json are gone by the

time of destruction.



After the CL: Check the flag once, on construction. From then on,

check absl::holds_alternative<>. This could potentially uncover

other problems but at least fixes android_sync_integration_tests for

me locally.



Fixed: 328252586

Change-Id: Ibd195c5ddbad347a8fdd0a44d1596de6ddf31119

> [WebView][WebAuthn] Introduce WebSettings.setWebAuthnSupport

>

> The support is per WebView. Hence, we cache the support per WebContents.

entry.title: Revert "Skip static animations on compositor and main"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 3690cd7872423e81e74dc66f9886e355a7c1b659.



Reason for revert: virtual/threaded-no-composited-antialiasing/animations

tests started failing on multiple builders after this CL.

* https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-bfcache-rel

* https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/mac11-arm64-rel-tests

* https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/mac12-arm64-rel-tests

* https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20Tests



Original change's description:

> Skip static animations on compositor and main

>

> An animation with empty keyframes or with keyframes whose property

> values are identical between frames previously ran as a normal

> animation. As there is no visual change other than at a phase boundary,

> these animations do not need to run on the compositor, and only need

> to be scheduled on the main thread at phase boundaries.

>

> This is the first step in optimizing no-op animations. A follow up

> patch will short-circuit sampling when the property value is constant.

> Another patch will refine the rules for background color compositing

> to only consider dynamic properties. Finally, metrics will be added

> to track shorthand expansion of CSS properties, which is likely the

> most common source of static properties in CSS animations.

>

> Bug: 40728212

> Change-Id: I1baff2d0d26400f91f12d4cac2141e9bb101b3d0

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5328026

> Reviewed-by: Ian Clelland

> Reviewed-by: Robert Flack

> Commit-Queue: Kevin Ellis

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1268998}



Bug: 40728212

Change-Id: Idccfa689d7a3b6e6ee9e2b6a5d109c94a4d3870b

entry.title: GPU: Defer IOSurface backing's Dawn's WaitForCommandsToBeScheduled.
entry.content:
Defer dawn::native::metal::WaitForCommandsToBeScheduled call

until OverlayRepresentation::BeginReadAccess() or

IOSurfaceImageBacking::IOSurfaceBackingEGLStateBeginAccess() is

executed.

eglWaitUntilWorkScheduledANGLE.

entry.title: Add inline sizes to the Vectors in InvalidationSetFeatures.
entry.content:
This fixes heavy PartitionAlloc activity during initial style;

since these Vectors are only on the stack, we don't need to do

all that allocation. Stack initialization probably now also becomes

more expensive, which we ameliorate by adding STACK_UNINITIALIZED.



The inline size of 4 is set pretty arbitrarily; most of these seem

entry.title: Reland "[ios] Improve build/toolchain/ios/swiftc.py script"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 555b7f43f59a6291b935c1dd8e99fc6ce77d183e



Fixes the following issues that lead to reverting the original CL:



1. The compilation was sometimes considered dirty after an incremental

build due to optimizations in both the script (FileWriter) and in

swiftc itself where output file are not overwritten if identical.



This was fixed by removing the use of FileWriter from the script and

by touching all the outputs of the compilation (thus the file should

now have newer timestamp than the source).



2. The compilation for catalyst environment was broken because swiftc

expects different command-line argument for that environment (i.e.

-isystem is unsupported, -Xcc ... is also unsupported).



The script is modified to check whether the target triple

corresponds to the catalyst environment (i.e. matches *-macabi)

and constructs an acceptable command-line.



3. As `gn check ...` did not know about the Objective-C generated

header for Swift modules, some dependencies were missing which

also caused dirty build after an incremental build. This was

fixed by https://crrev.com/c/5348787.



Original change's description:

> [ios] Improve build/toolchain/ios/swiftc.py script

>

> Change the script build/toolchain/ios/swiftc.py to configure the

> swift compiler to generate $input.swiftconstvalues files (needed

> for Intents API in swift).

>

> Improve the code to put all the derived data in one directory,

> which allow removing the need for -pch-output-dir $dir from the

> invocation of the script and its list of outputs (should avoid

> the compilation error where $dir is created as a file instead of

> a directory).

>

> Change toolchain.gni to pass all the tool versions as environment

> variables instead of command-line arguments (reduce the length of

> the command-line and remove the need to parse those arguments in

> the script).

>

> Allow keeping the derived data dir between invocations of the

> script (which may improve the build performance as the swiftc

> binary will not have to rebuild the module cache each time).

>

> Bug: 326059372

> Change-Id: I5e42676eb917fe2d355383aaa39a60d5674816fb

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5319176

> Commit-Queue: Sylvain Defresne

> Reviewed-by: Federica Germinario

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1268444}



Bug: 326059372

entry.title: Fix access to client cert pattern in NetworkConnectionHandlerImpl
entry.content:
NetworkConnectionHandlerImpl needs to distinguish if a client

certificate pattern is configured for a service. This regressed in

CL:3634816. That CL changed retrieval of network policies to be able to

request "original" policies (as they came from the policy server) and

"policies with runtime values" where things like placeholders and client

certificate patterns are replaced with their runtime resolved values.



NetworkConnectionHandlerImpl should have been using

PolicyType::kOriginal, but accidentally I used

PolicyType::kWithRuntimeValues.



The unit test didn't catch this because it didn't run the code that the

client certificate resolver would run to set the resolved certiifcate

(to "nothing matched" in this case).



Fix the network policy access and unit test.



Bug: b:319188170

Test: chromeos_unittests --gtest_filter=NetworkConnectionHandlerImplTest.ConnectCertificateMissing

Change-Id: I57a8724dc14a20679c2d372605b11195914cbb3b

entry.title: Separate out update part of SaveUpdateAddressProfileBubbleControllerImpl.
entry.content:
This CL is a part of the work on separating SaveUpdateAddressProfile*

into the "Save" and "Update" parts. High level (not necessarily matching

the CLs) overview of the work to be done:

* Split `SaveUpdateAddressProfileBubbleControllerImpl` into 3 (or 4)

parts:

* `AddressBubbleController` - shows/hides specific bubbles,

controls the page action icon

* `SaveAddressBubbleController` - save-relevant methods from

`SaveUpdateAddressProfileBubbleController`

* `UpdateAddressBubbleController` - update-relevant methods

* Maybe `BaseAddressBubbleController` - common methods from

`SaveUpdateAddressProfileBubbleController`

* Move the bubble type decision to

`ChromeAutofillClient::ConfirmSaveAddressProfile`

* Rename `SaveUpdateAddressProfileIconController` to

`AutofillAddressIconController`

* Rename `PageActionIconType::kSaveAutofillAddress` to

`PageActionIconType::kAutofillAddress`

* Later (out of scope of this refactoring, but dependent on it): add

the "Add new address" bubble.

WebHistoryService and its factory used to check for ConsentLevel::kSync

and IsSyncFeatureActive(), for historic reasons.

This CL removes the unnecessary IsSyncFeatureActive() check in the

factory (the remaining GetActiveDataTypes() check covers all the

necessary conditions), and also removes the ConsentLevel::kSync usage

in the service itself (behind the kReplaceSyncPromosWithSignInPromos

feature).



The same changes were previously made for iOS in crrev.com/c/4725068

and crrev.com/c/4813815.

entry.title: iwa: Owned bundles can now be dev-mode or prod-mode
entry.content:
This will allow us to copy dev mode bundles into the profile directory.

Currently, using dev mode bundles is half-broken, because when you

update the bundle on disk, our code does not realize that the bundle

was updated and instead continues reading at offsets based on metadata

from the old bundle. This CL is the pre-requisite for optionally copying

dev-mode bundles into the profile directory, instead of referencing

them.



Eventually, I think it would be nice to

a) fix our code to support the developer updating a referenced dev-mode

bundle file on disk without it messing up open readers for it.

b) give developers the option to specify whether they want to copy their

bundles into the profile directory (to have it installed a bit more

permanently), or keep the current behavior where the bundle remains

outside of the browser's control and can be updated by the developer

easily.



Fixed: 287594073

Bug: 325595783, 40239527

Change-Id: Ic8b6833601fc225c575a0cb0ced181ba3a368a48

entry.title: [FspCache] Vend a ContentCache to each CloudFileSystem on init
entry.content:
The CacheManager manages the logic that relates to all the individual

FSP content caches. When an FSP mounts, it requires access to an

in-memory LRU cache, a connection to the SQLite database and access to

the files on disk. All these parts are aggregated in this new class

called the ContentCache.



To avoid persisting data on disk, this also introduces a boolean that

can be enabled on the CacheManager to not create the FspContentCache

directory.



Bug: b/317137739

Test: unit_tests --gtest_filter=FileSystemProviderCacheManagerTest*

entry.title: Reland "Sync bounds for mirror layers."
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit bfd714210e762ddbf54b4261ed514feb879da572



Previously, this broke because tile occlusion was not enabled and

old content was being shown with wrong bounds, so syncing to those

bounds made everything transparent.



With tile occlusion enabled, windows know when they are shown and will

produce new content, so sync bounds should get content with proper

bounds it is safe to sync to. Without this, old bounds from snapshots

will be positioned incorrectly and show some transparent gap.



Original change's description:

> Sync bounds for mirror layers.

>

> Bug: 40223673

> Test: CQ + local testing

> Change-Id: I457f4cb7f58d105ab3cac7c0031b58735864a222

entry.title: Remove CHECK for state->readable()
entry.content:
This CL removes existing CHECK if the mojo state is readable, right

after Read() method. Because in rare case state->readable() is false

even right after DataPipe::ReadData() and the result was success [1].



We can't guarantee that the state is always readable, but probably it's

okay to ignore the state because the data pipe already gave the buffer

info, and the next Read() will be called when it's readable next time.

Also we set a crash key for the future crash. So this CL just removes

CHECK().



Note: We need to call DataPipe::ReadData() even it's not readable state

to know that we read all data in the data pipe. So we can't move this to

before calling DataPipe::ReadData().



[1] https://crash.corp.google.com/browse?q=expanded_custom_data.ChromeCrashProto.magic_signature_1.name+LIKE+%27%25ServiceWorkerRaceNetworkRequest%25%27+AND+product.Version%3D%27124.0.6341.0%27&stbtiq=&reportid=&index=0#0



Bug: 327749443

entry.title: Fix possible null pointer dereference in RenderFrameHostImpl::GetPage
entry.content:
Currently if you call RenderFrameHost::GetPage on RFH which commits

navigation from under the following stack you will get invalid Page

reference (dereferenced null pointer) because

DocumentAssociatedData::owned_page_ is set to null at the moment.



base::SupportsUserData::ClearAllUserData()

content.dll!content::PageImpl::~PageImpl()

...

std::__Cr::unique_ptr::~unique_ptr()

content::DocumentAssociatedData::~DocumentAssociatedData()

...

std::__Cr::optional::emplace...

content::RenderFrameHostImpl::DidCommitNavigationInternal

content::RenderFrameHostImpl::DidCommitNavigation

...



This could happen in practice if a custom PageUserData implementation is being destroyed and a code called from the destructor ends up trying to reference RFH::GetPage().



Proposed fix is to clear Page user data before destroying owned_page_.



Change-Id: I9d8960cfd8b4a9fbec2c7888513b3f0823e7972f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5323981

entry.title: [Telemetry] Restrict manufacturer fallback to certain models
entry.content:
We plan to deprecate the fallback logic for reading manufacturer from

DMI. Restrict the fallback to certain models in order to limit the

impact and prevent new models from relying on DMI.



telemetry extension APIs are both accessible or both not

accessible before and after the changes.

1. model=eldrid, with cros-config filled

2. model=drawcia, with cros-config not filled but with DMI filled

3. model=lillipup, with both cros-config and DMI not filled



Bug: b:325560417, b:300015436

entry.title: ELUD: Improve the initialization process
entry.content:
It turned out that the default PartitionRoot for PA-E may not have

been configured(initialized) by the time that

InstallExtremeLightweightDetectorHooks() is called.



This patch supports a lazy set-up process of Extreme LUD so that

it's okay that the default PartitionRoot will be configured later.



This patch also supports the parameter configuration.



Bug: 1503587

entry.title: LCPP: PredictFetchedFontUrls() returns an empty list on the feature disabled
entry.content:
Currently, even if the feature flag is disabled, the font URLs are

returned to PredictFetchedFontUrls() callers. It means that caller gets

the hint data regardless of the feature is enabled or not, and it can

be sent to the renderer.



For ease of ensuring the flag, let me enforce that by not sending a hint

to the callers.



In the coming CL, I plan to use this for consolidating the threshold

implementation.



Bug: 316229761

Change-Id: I08743a37694a5a85bc5c5af07e1d2b441f98f82b

entry.title: Fix crash in enterprise_data_protection::OnRealTimeLookupComplete.
entry.content:
Fix a null pointer deference that happens when navigating to a new URL,

enterprise realtime URL checks are enabled, and some error occurs that

causes the check to fail.



With this fix no watermark is enabled for this page in the tab. This

information is cached for this page in this tab. Will discuss to see

what the expected behaviour should be.

entry.title: Use InsertNodeBefore() on indenting a <blockquote>
entry.content:
This CL replaces InsertNodeAfter() with InsertNodeBefore() on indenting

a
. InsertNodeAfter() has been used since [1].

When a eixsting
has an image and a created


for indenting is inserted after the existing node, the selection for

deletion after cloning is canonicalized to non-range and

DeleteSelection() does nothing. It causes there are two
s

with children, one is the existing
supposed to be deleted

and the other is the cloned
.

In order to fix the issue above, this change uses InsertNodeBefore()

instead of InsertNodeAfter() to find the next node and the previous node

for canonicalization without interference of the inserted


and have the correct selection for deletion.



[1] http://crbug.com/625802



Bug: 327665597

Change-Id: I3362a589ae5ac886fe301f605c2f0100807b3e39

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5334700

Reviewed-by: Xiaocheng Hu

Commit-Queue: Julie Jeongeun Kim

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1269384}

entry.title: Reland "Synchronize the VCD buffer pool with camera HAL"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 4969eba67d92afd1dff8c135323a32d6c3638535.



Original CL is reverted due to breaking Brya builder videoconferencing tests in b:231110972. But the tast test failure actually is not related to this CL, it's because the Mojo uprev was not synchronized properly. So this CL simply reland the original CL without any change.



Original change's description:

> Synchronize the VCD buffer pool with camera HAL

>

> This CL adds the OnNewBuffer/OnBufferRetired method to notify the camera HAL to synchronize with the video capture buffer pool.

>

> Platform2 side change is in CL:4464677.

>

entry.title: camera: Let VCDDelegate observe power events on SystemEventMonitor
entry.content:
Since VCDDelegate is going to be moved to its utility process, it can't

rely on any global variable which is only available in ash. This CL

decouples the dependency and let VCDDelegate observe power events on

SystemEventMonitor which can be requested from mojo service manager.



Bug: b:315966244, b:319180869

Test: Test system resume/suspend and verify camera is opened/closed
